tit.j: タンゴエクスプローラー

sen.j: タンゴエクスプローラー（Tango Explorer）とは、北近畿タンゴ鉄道KTR001形気動車の愛称であり、同車両を使用して運行される北近畿タンゴ鉄道・西日本旅客鉄道の特別急行列車の愛称である。
sen.e: Tango Explorer is the nickname for Kitakinki Tango Railway KTR001 series diesel railcars and also the nickname for the limited express trains that Kitakinki Tango Railway and West Japan Railway Company run using the diesel railcars.

Tango Explorer is the nickname for Kitakinki Tango Railway KTR001 Series diesel railcars and also the nickname for the limited express trains that Kitakinki Tango Railway and West Japan Railway Company run using diesel railcars.

Tango Explorer is the nickname for Kitakinki Tango Railway KTR Type 001 diesel multiple unit and also the nickname for the limited express trains that Kitakinki Tango Railway and West Japan Railway Company run using diesel railcars.
sen.cmt: KTR001形気動車→KTR Type 001 diesel multiple unit としました（他の記事と統一）。

sen.j: 英語で「丹後国探検者」という意味である。
sen.e: It is an English expression meaning "persons exploring the Tango province."
It's an English expression meaning "persons exploring the province of Tango."
It's an English expression meaning 'persons exploring the province of Tango.'

sen.j: 2008年現在、新大阪駅～宮津駅・豊岡駅 (兵庫県)間を福知山線・北近畿タンゴ鉄道宮福線・北近畿タンゴ鉄道宮津線経由で運行されており、北近畿ビッグXネットワークを形成する列車の一つである。
sen.e: As of 2008, Tango Explorer, limited express trains constituting so called "the North Kinki Big X Network," is operated between Shin-Osaka station and Miyazu Station/Tyooka Station (located in Hyogo Prefecture) via the Fukuchiyama Line, the Yiyafuku Line of Kitakinki Tango Railway and the Miyazu Line of Kitakinki Tango Railway,

As of 2008, Tango Explorer, limited express trains constituting the so-called "North Kinki Big X Network," are operated between Shin-Osaka station and Miyazu Station/Tyooka Station (located in Hyogo Prefecture) via the Fukuchiyama Line, the Yiyafuku Line of Kitakinki Tango Railway and the Miyazu Line of Kitakinki Tango Railway.

As of 2008, Tango Explorer is a train constituting the so-called "North Kinki Big X Network," and is operated between Shin-Osaka Station and Miyazu Station/Toyooka Station (Hyogo Prefecture) via the Fukuchiyama Line, the Miyafuku Line of Kitakinki Tango Railway and the Miyazu Line of Kitakinki Tango Railway.
sen.cmt: 文頭を一部修正しました。

sen.j: 1990年の運行開始から1999年までは京都駅をターミナルとする列車であったが、使用車両を北近畿タンゴ鉄道KTR8000形気動車「タンゴディスカバリー」と交換したことにより、列車愛称も交換された。
sen.e: From 1990, when the operation of the trains started, to 1999, the trains used Kyoto Station as its terminal, but the nickname for the trains was changed to the present one when the train cars were replaced with Kitakinki Tango Railway KTR8000 series diesel railcars, "Tango Discovery."

During the period from 1990, when the operation of the trains started, to 1999, the trains used Kyoto Station as their terminal, but the nickname for the trains was changed to the present one when the train cars were replaced with Kitakinki Tango Railway KTR8000 Series diesel railcars, "Tango Discovery."

During the period from 1990, when the operation of the trains started, to 1999, the trains used Kyoto Station as their terminal, but the nickname for the trains was changed to the present one when the train cars were replaced with Kitakinki Tango Railway KTR Type 8000 diesel multiple unit, 'Tango Discovery.'
sen.cmt: 北近畿タンゴ鉄道KTR8000形気動車→Kitakinki Tango Railway KTR Type 8000 diesel multiple unit としました（他の記事と統一）。

sen.j: 運行概況
sen.e: Operation summary
Summary of operations
Summary of operations

sen.j: 基本的には福知山駅で「きのさき (列車)」に連絡するようになっている。
sen.e: Basically, the train is operated so as to be connected with a "Kinosaki"limited express train at Fukuchiyama Station
Basically, the train is operated so as to be connected with a "Kinosaki" limited express train at Fukuchiyama Station.
Basically, the train is operated so as to be connected with a Limited Express 'Kinosaki (train)' at Fukuchiyama Station.

sen.j: 使用車両は北近畿タンゴ鉄道所有の北近畿タンゴ鉄道KTR001形気動車で運行される。
sen.e: The trains are operated using Kitakinki Tango Railway KTR001 series diesel railcars owned by Kitakinki Tango Railway.
The trains are operated using the Kitakinki Tango Railway KTR001 Series diesel railcars owned by Kitakinki Tango Railway.
The trains are operated using the Kitakinki Tango Railway KTR Type 001 diesel multiple unit owned by Kitakinki Tango Railway.
sen.cmt: KTR001形気動車→KTR Type 001 diesel multiple unit としました（他の記事と統一）。

sen.j: 3両編成で運行され、1・4号は1両、3・2号は2両が自由席車である。
sen.e: Of the three train cars organized in the operation, one is for non-reserved seats for Tango Explorer 1 and 4, and two for Tango Explorer 2 and 3.
Of the three train cars organized in the operation, one is for non-reserved seats for Tango Explorer 1 and 4, and two are for Tango Explorer 2 and 3.
Of the three train cars organized in the operation, one car is for non-reserved seats for Tango Explorer nos. 1 and 4, and two cars are for non-reserved seats for Tango Explorer nos. 2 and 3.
sen.cmt: 原文に沿って変更しました。

sen.j: また、土曜・休日・多客期には2編成をつないで6両編成で運行することもある（非貫通構造のため3号車と4号車の通り抜けは不可）。
sen.e: Six-car trains, combining two ordinary three-car trains, are sometimes used on Saturdys, Sundays or in the seasons when many passengers are expected to use these trains, but you cannot move between the third train car and the fourth train car, because no passage between them is provided.

Six-car trains, combining two ordinary three-car trains, are sometimes used on Saturdays, Sundays or in the seasons when many passengers are expected to use these trains, but one can't move between the third train car and the fourth train car because no passage between them is provided.

Six-car trains, combining two sets of three-car trains, are sometimes used on Saturdays, Sundays or in the seasons when many passengers are expected to use these trains, but one can't move between the third train car and the fourth train car because no passage between them is provided.
sen.cmt: two sets of としました。

sen.j: また、6両運転時には新大阪寄りの3両が天橋立（1・4号）で増・解結されることもある。
sen.e: In six-car organization, the three cars on the Shin-Osaka side are those of Amanohashidate 1 or 4, which are sometimes added or detached.
In the six-car configuration, the three cars on the Shin-Osaka side are those of Amanohashidate 1 or 4, which are sometimes added or detached.
In the six-car configuration, the three cars on the Shin-Osaka side are those of Amanohashidate nos. 1 or 4, which are sometimes added or detached.

sen.j: また、福知山まで客扱い（3・2号、車両回送目的で、空車にて連結）することもある。
sen.e: In addition, the train sometimes handles passengers up to Fukushiyama (on Tango Explorer 2 and 3, with additional cars connected without passengers simply for moving these cars to another location).
sen.cmt: この文章は理解できませんでしたので、字句どうりに訳してあります。
sen.e: Additionally, the train sometimes handles passengers up to Fukushiyama (on Tango Explorer 2 and 3, with additional cars connected without passengers simply in order to move these cars to another location).

Additionally, the train sometimes handles passengers up to Fukuchiyama (on Tango Explorer nos. 2 and 3, with additional cars connected without passengers simply in order to move these cars to another location).
sen.cmt: nos. 2 or 3 としました。Fukuchiyama としました。

sen.j: 北近畿タンゴ鉄道KTR8000形気動車が代走することがある。
sen.e: Kitakinki Tango Railway KTR8000 series diesel railcars are sometimes operated instead of Kitakinki Tango Railway KTR001 series diesel railcars.
Kitakinki Tango Railway KTR8000 Series diesel railcars are sometimes operated instead of the Kitakinki Tango Railway KTR001 Series diesel railcars.
Kitakinki Tango Railway KTR Type 8000 diesel multiple unit is sometimes operated instead of the Kitakinki Tango Railway KTR Type 001 diesel multiple unit.
sen.cmt: 北近畿タンゴ鉄道KTR8000形気動車→Kitakinki Tango Railway KTR Type 8000 diesel multiple unit としました（他の記事と統一）。

sen.j: 運用としては以下の通りである。
sen.e: The trains are operated in the following ways:
The trains are operated in the following ways:
The trains are operated in the following ways:

sen.j: 西舞鶴駅→（快速列車）→宮津駅→（2号）→新大阪駅→（回送）→吹田駅 (JR西日本)引上線→（回送）→新大阪駅→（1号）→豊岡駅 (兵庫県)→（4号）→新大阪駅→（回送）→高槻駅→（回送）→新大阪駅→（3号）→宮津駅→（普通列車）→西舞鶴駅
sen.e: Nishi-Maizuru Station => (a rapid train) => Miyazu Station (Tango Explorer 2) => Shin-Osaka Station => (deadheaded) => a side track of Suita Station (of JR West) => (deadheaded) => Shin-Osaka Station => (Tango Explorer 1) => Toyooka Station (located in Hyogo Prefecture) => (Tango Explorer 4) => Shin-Osaka Station => (deadheaded) => Takatsuki STation => (deadheaded) =>Shin-Osaka Station => (Tango Explorer 3) => Miyazu Station => (a local train) => Nishi-Maizuru Station

Nishi-Maizuru Station => (a rapid train) => Miyazu Station (Tango Explorer 2) => Shin-Osaka Station => (deadheaded) => a side track of Suita Station (of JR West) => (deadheaded) => Shin-Osaka Station => (Tango Explorer 1) => Toyooka Station (located in Hyogo Prefecture) => (Tango Explorer 4) => Shin-Osaka Station => (deadheaded) => Takatsuki STation => (deadheaded) =>Shin-Osaka Station => (Tango Explorer 3) => Miyazu Station => (a local train) => Nishi-Maizuru Station

Nishi-Maizuru Station - (a rapid train) - Miyazu Station (Tango Explorer No. 2) - Shin-Osaka Station - (deadheaded) - a side track of Suita Station (JR West) - (deadheaded) - Shin-Osaka Station - (Tango Explorer No. 1) - Toyooka Station (Hyogo Prefecture) - (Tango Explorer No. 4) - Shin-Osaka Station - (deadheaded) - Takatsuki Station - (deadheaded) - Shin-Osaka Station - (Tango Explorer No. 3) - Miyazu Station - (a local train) - Nishi-Maizuru Station
sen.cmt: →をハイフンに変更しました。

sen.j: 運転本数
sen.e: The number of Tango Explorer trains that are operated
The number of Tango Explorer trains that are operated
Number of trains
sen.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。

sen.j: 編成
sen.e: Organization
Organization
Train set
sen.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。

sen.j: 備考
sen.e: Remarks
Remarks
Remarks

sen.j: 多客期にはもう一編成加えられる(その時は、1～3号車が豊岡・宮津まで、4～6号車が天橋立・福知山行となる。
sen.e: In the seasons when many passengers are expected to use the trains, the train cars with same organization are added (of the thus organized train cars, the first to third train cars go up to Toyooka/Miyazu, and the fourth to sixth train cars up to Amanohasidate/Fukuchiyama).

In the seasons when many passengers are expected to use the trains, the train cars with the same configuration are added (of the train cars thus organized, the first to third train cars go up to Toyooka/Miyazu, and the fourth to sixth train cars go up to Amanohasidate/Fukuchiyama).

In the seasons when many passengers are expected to use the trains, the train cars with the same configuration are added (of the train cars thus organized, the first to third train cars go up to Toyooka/Miyazu, and the fourth to sixth train cars go up to Amanohashidate/Fukuchiyama).

sen.j: また、自由席が2・3・5号車となる〔3・2号〕)。
sen.e: In the organization, the second, third and fifth train cars are for non-researved seats
In that configuration, the second, third and fifth train cars are for non-reserved seats.
In that configuration, the second, third and fifth train cars are for non-reserved seats.

sen.j: 停車駅
sen.e: The stations where Tango Explorer stops
The stations where Tango Explorer stops
Stops
sen.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。

sen.j: 新大阪駅 - 大阪駅 - 尼崎駅 (JR西日本) - 宝塚駅 - 三田駅 (兵庫県) - （新三田駅） - （相野駅） - 篠山口駅 - （谷川駅） - 柏原駅 (兵庫県) - （黒井駅 (兵庫県)） - 福知山駅 - 大江駅 (京都府) - 宮津駅 - 天橋立駅 - 野田川駅 - 丹後大宮駅 - 峰山駅 - 網野駅 - 木津温泉駅 - 久美浜駅 - 豊岡駅 (兵庫県)
sen.e: Shin-Osaka Station => Osaka Station => Amagasaki Station (of JR West) => Takarazuka Station => Sanda Station (located in Hyogo Prefecture) => (Shin-Sanda Station) => (Aino Station) => Sasayamaguchi Station => (Tanikawa Station) => Kaibara Station (located in Hyogo Prefecture) => (Kuroi Station (located in Hyogo Prefecture)) => Fukuchiyama Station =>Oe Station (located in Kyoto Prefecture) => Miyazu Station => Amanohashidate Station => Nodagawa Station => Tango-Omiya Station => Mineyama Station => Amino Station => Kitsu-onsen Station => Kumihama Station => Toyooka Station (located in Hyogo Prefecture)

Shin-Osaka Station => Osaka Station => Amagasaki Station (of JR West) => Takarazuka Station => Sanda Station (located in Hyogo Prefecture) => (Shin-Sanda Station) => (Aino Station) => Sasayamaguchi Station => (Tanikawa Station) => Kaibara Station (located in Hyogo Prefecture) => (Kuroi Station (located in Hyogo Prefecture)) => Fukuchiyama Station =>Oe Station (located in Kyoto Prefecture) => Miyazu Station => Amanohashidate Station => Nodagawa Station => Tango-Omiya Station => Mineyama Station => Amino Station => Kitsu-onsen Station => Kumihama Station => Toyooka Station (located in Hyogo Prefecture)

Shin-Osaka Station - Osaka Station - Amagasaki Station (R West) - Takarazuka Station - Sanda Station (Hyogo Prefecture) - (Shin-Sanda Station) - (Aino Station) - Sasayamaguchi Station - (Tanikawa Station) - Kaibara Station (Hyogo Prefecture) - (Kuroi Station (Hyogo Prefecture)) - Fukuchiyama Station - Oe Station (Kyoto Prefecture) - Miyazu Station - Amanohashidate Station - Nodagawa Station - Tango-Omiya Station - Mineyama Station - Amino Station - Kitsu-onsen Station - Kumihama Station - Toyooka Station (Hyogo Prefecture)

sen.j: 沿革
sen.e: History
History
History

sen.j: 1990年 - 当時のJR西日本宮津線が北近畿タンゴ鉄道へ移管したことにより、京都駅～久美浜駅間を山陰本線・舞鶴線・宮津線経由で運行する特急列車として運行開始。
sen.e: 1990 - The Miyazu Line of JR West was transferred to Kitakinki Tango Railway, and operation of this limited express train, between Kyoto Station and Kumihama Station via the San'in Main Line, the Mizuru Line and the Miyazu Line, started.

1990: The Miyazu Line of JR West was transferred to Kitakinki Tango Railway, and the operation of this limited express train started between Kyoto Station and Kumihama Station via the San'in Main Line, the Mizuru Line and the Miyazu Line.

1990: The Miyazu Line of JR West was transferred to Kitakinki Tango Railway, and the operation of this limited express train started between Kyoto Station and Kumihama Station via the Sanin Main Line, the Maizuru Line and the Miyazu Line.
sen.cmt: アポストロフィを削除し、sanin としました。Maizuru としました。

sen.j: 基本的な運行経路としては以下の通りであった。
sen.e: Basically, the following routes were used:
Basically, the following routes were used:
Basically, the following routes were used:

sen.j: 網野駅～京都駅（宮津線・宮福線・山陰本線経由）：2号
sen.e: Between Amino Station and Kyoto Station (via the Miyazu Line, the Miyafuku Line and the San'in Main Line): Tango Explorer 2
Between Amino Station and Kyoto Station (via the Miyazu Line, the Miyafuku Line and the San'in Main Line): Tango Explorer 2
Between Amino Station and Kyoto Station (via the Miyazu Line, the Miyafuku Line and the Sanin Main Line): Tango Explorer No. 2
sen.cmt: アポストロフィを削除し、sanin としました。No. を追加しました。

sen.j: 京都駅～久美浜駅（山陰本線・舞鶴線・宮津線経由）：1・4号
sen.e: Between Kyoto Station and Kumihama Station (via the San'in Main Line, the Maizuru Line and the Miyazu Line): Tango Explorer 1 and 4
Between Kyoto Station and Kumihama Station (via the San'in Main Line, the Maizuru Line and the Miyazu Line): Tango Explorer 1 and 4
Between Kyoto Station and Kumihama Station (via the Sanin Main Line, the Maizuru Line and the Miyazu Line): Tango Explorer nos. 1 and 4
sen.cmt: アポストロフィを削除し、sanin としました。No. を追加しました。

sen.j: 京都駅 &amprarr 西舞鶴駅（山陰本線・舞鶴線経由）：3号
sen.e: Between Kyoto Station and Nishimaizuru Station (via the San'in Maina Line and the Maizuru Line): Tango Explorer 3
Between Kyoto Station and Nishimaizuru Station (via the San'in Main Line and the Maizuru Line): Tango Explorer 3
Between Kyoto Station and Nishi-Maizuru Station (via the Sanin Main Line and the Maizuru Line): Tango Explorer No. 3
sen.cmt: アポストロフィを削除し、sanin としました。No. を追加しました。

sen.j: 1992年 - 上り4号を豊岡駅 (兵庫県)始発とする。
sen.e: 1992- Inbound Tango Explorer 4 became to start at Toyooka Station (located in Hyogo Prefecture).
1992: Inbound Tango Explorer 4 began starting at Toyooka Station (in Hyogo Prefecture).
1992: Inbound Tango Explorer No. 4 began starting at Toyooka Station (Hyogo Prefecture).

sen.j: 1996年 - 上り2号の宮福線経由から宮津線・舞鶴線とする。
sen.e: 1996 -Inbound Tango Explorer 2 became to be operated via Miyazu Line and the Maizuru Line instead of the Miyafuku Line.
1996: Inbound Tango Explorer 2 began operating via Miyazu Line and the Maizuru Line instead of the Miyafuku Line.
1996: Inbound Tango Explorer No. 2 began operating via Miyazu Line and the Maizuru Line instead of the Miyafuku Line.

sen.j: 1999年 - 「タンゴディスカバリー」と入れ替わりに現行の新大阪駅発着となる。
sen.e: 1999 - The present operation starting at Shin-Osaka started, replacing that of "Tango Discovery."
1999: The present operation starting at Shin-Osaka started, replacing that of "Tango Discovery."
1999: The present operation starting at Shin-Osaka started, replacing that of 'Tango Discovery.'

sen.j: 2005年4月25日 - JR福知山線脱線事故が発生し、新大阪駅～福知山駅間が運休となる。
sen.e: April 25, 2005 - A derailing accident occurred on the JR Fukuchiyama Line, and its operation between Shin-Osaka Station and Fukuchiyama was suspended.
April 25, 2005: A derailing accident occurred on the JR Fukuchiyama Line, and its operation between Shin-Osaka Station and Fukuchiyama was suspended.
April 25, 2005: A derailing accident occurred on the JR Fukuchiyama Line, and its operation between Shin-Osaka Station and Fukuchiyama was suspended.

sen.j: 2005年6月19日 - 運転を再開。
sen.e: June 19, 2005 - The operation restarted.
June 19, 2005: The operation restarted.
June 19, 2005: The operation restarted.

sen.j: KTR001形が自動列車停止装置ATS-P形（デジタル伝送パターン形）に対応しないため、「タンゴディスカバリー」用の北近畿タンゴ鉄道KTR8000形気動車で運行を行う。
sen.e: The KTR001 series train cars do not support the ATS-P type automatic train stop system (for a digital pattern transmission type), and Kitakinki Tango Railway KTR8000 series train cars for "Tango Discovery" were used for the operation of Tango Explorer.

The KTR001 Series train cars don't support the ATS-P type automatic train stop system (for a digital pattern transmission type), and Kitakinki Tango Railway KTR8000 Series train cars for "Tango Discovery" were used for the operation of Tango Explorer.

The KTR Type 001 diesel multiple unit does not support the ATS-P type automatic train stop system (for a digital pattern transmission type), and Kitakinki Tango Railway KTR Type 8000 diesel multiple unit for 'Tango Discovery' was used for the operation of Tango Explorer.
sen.cmt: 北近畿タンゴ鉄道KTR8000形気動車→Kitakinki Tango Railway KTR Type 8000 diesel multiple unit としました（他の記事と統一）。

sen.j: 2007年3月18日 - ダイヤ改正に伴い全車禁煙化の上でKTR001形気動車での運行に戻る。
sen.e: March 18, 2007 - The train operation schedulre was revised, and the KTR001 series train cars became to be used again for the operation of Tango Explorer, with smoking being prohibied at all of the seats.
March 18, 2007: The train operation schedule was revised, and the KTR001 Series train cars started being used again for the operation of Tango Explorer, with smoking prohibited in all seats.
March 18, 2007: The train operation schedule was revised, and the KTR Type 001 diesel multiple unit started being used again for the operation of Tango Explorer, with smoking prohibited in all seats.
sen.cmt: 北近畿タンゴ鉄道KTR001形気動車→Kitakinki Tango Railway KTR Type 001 diesel multiple unit としました（他の記事と統一）。

sen.j: また、1・4号が豊岡駅まで運行区間を延長する。
sen.e: In addition, the operation of Tango Explorer 1 and 4 was extended up to Toyooka Station.
Moreover, the operation of Tango Explorer 1 and 4 was extended up to Toyooka Station.
Moreover, the operation of Tango Explorer nos. 1 and 4 was extended up to Toyooka Station.

sen.j: 2008年2月20日 - ATS故障の関係で、JR西日本の国鉄183系電車が代替で運行された。
sen.e: February 20, 2008 - Its ATS malfunctioned and JR 183 series train cars of JR West were used for its operation instead.
February 20, 2008: Its ATS malfunctioned, so JR 183 Series train cars of JR West were used for its operation instead.
February 20, 2008: Its ATS malfunctioned, so JNR Series 183 train cars of JR West were used for its operation instead.
sen.cmt: 国鉄183系→JNR Series 183 としました（他の記事と統一）。
